intro: Haasia, commonly known as the marsh hawthorn, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species that are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their dense, evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. Haasia species often thrive in moist, acidic soils and are commonly found in wetlands or along stream banks. They play an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
